Ketra.name: Gelatinous Form
Ketra.description: You have an inherent weakness to salt damage, but can squeeze and compress your body enough to move through spaces much smaller than expected.

Ketra.name: Sensory Stalks
Ketra.description: A rare mutation that hones your sight. You can see clearly without light.

Ketra.name: Crawling Pattern
Ketra.description: The glowing patches on your flesh crawl at your command, even onto others nearby. Mark this track to create a dim but lasting light on you or a nearby target.

Ketra.name: Tunnel-Wise
Ketra.description: Treat conflicts as triumphs when navigating or moving through enclosed areas.

Ketra.name: Whispers in the Dark
Ketra.description: While in a dimly lit or unlit area, mark to learn a secret from the darkness (once per scene).

Ketra.name: Scrapper Enzymes
Ketra.description: You can use salvage as a component when concocting a potion or chemical mixture, no matter its form.

Ketra.name: Voltaic Mantle
Ketra.description: The tendrils of your mantle crackle with lightning as they strike, dealing CQ volt damage.

Ketra.name: Driftwood Core
Ketra.description: You're resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Blunt, Spike, Toxin, Frost, Volt.

Ketra.name: Rebreather Mask
Ketra.description: You have a short supply of clean air you can tap into when you need to, and you also resist the effects of bad air and airborne spores.

Ketra.name: Climbing Hooks
Ketra.description: Attached to a harness or embedded in your gelatinous flesh. Ignore cut while climbing, as long as you're moving with care.

Ketra.name: Driving-Chain
Ketra.description: A rusted chain from a long-dead machine, now wielded as a weapon dealing blunt damage at CQ or LR.

Ketra.name: Scrap-Metal Skeleton
Ketra.description: The internal structures you've collected can store biovoltaic energy. Use a task to create a resource, Scrap-Bone Battery.

Ketra.name: Old Ore Piercings
Ketra.description: You're immune to the usual effects of crezzerin. Concentrated sources of crezzerin heal rather than harm you.

Ketra.name: Oiljelly
Ketra.description: A slick, symbiotic slime-like creature bonded with your body.

Ketra.name: Drone Attendant
Ketra.description: A simple punchcard-driven repair construct. Increase impact when repairing or tinkering with other machines.

Ketra.name: Plasmic Form
Ketra.description: Your flesh is malleable and regenerative, even by Ketra standards. Mark Mire to gain a rare resource, Living Protoplasmic Flesh.

Ridgeback.name: Barrel-Chested
Ridgeback.description: You may not be built fancy, but you are built sturdy.

Ridgeback.name: Stone Hearted
Ridgeback.description: Once per scene, increase impact on any successful action taken whilst on ancient ground.

Ridgeback.name: Search for Omens
Ridgeback.description: Mark to ask a question and receive an omen to interpret in return (supplied by the Firefly).

Ridgeback.name: Thick Skin
Ridgeback.description: You're resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Blunt, Toxin, Cold, Salt, Volt.

Ridgeback.name: Crushing Blows
Ridgeback.description: Your fists and feet are the only weapons you need. They deal CQ blunt and salt damage.

Ridgeback.name: Fragments Like Gods
Ridgeback.description: Whenever you gain a stone-based resource, give it the Sacred tag.

Ridgeback.name: Archaeodermis
Ridgeback.description: Your skin (or whatever you have as an outer covering) mimics the mountain you were raised on. You're immune to keen damage, as well as bites and stings from small creatures.

Ridgeback.name: Chipping Tools
Ridgeback.description: Treat conflicts as triumphs when altering or working with stone or bone

Ridgeback.name: Leviathan Furs
Ridgeback.description: You never mark mire when confronted with an unknown or terrifying beast, no matter the size.

Ridgeback.name: Ritual Mask
Ridgeback.description: You can clearly see spirits and the spectral realm.

Ridgeback.name: Whispering Charm
Ridgeback.description: Consume a whisper to learn a secret about a nearby individual (supplied by the Firefly).

Ridgeback.name: Hexed Tooth
Ridgeback.description: Mark to levitate and control exposed bone.

Ridgeback.name: Great Beast Horns
Ridgeback.description: These might have deep ceremonial meaning, or just cut an impressive silhouette - either way these horns deal CQ spike damage, and you ignore cut when defending yourself against charging opponents.

Ridgeback.name: Shamanic Idol
Ridgeback.description: Holds a sliver of power from a not-quite-god. Deals LR salt damage.

Ridgeback.name: Swift Hawk
Ridgeback.description: A surly, vicious bird that can deal LR keen damage. Once per scene, hijack to temporarily blind or distract an attacking opponent.

Ridgeback.name: Mountain Snouter
Ridgeback.description: An ill-tempered boar with cruel tusks. Deals CQ spike damage, and is large enough to ride.

Ridgeback.name: Surface Stone
Ridgeback.description: Not somethign to be worshipped, but most definitely something to be remembered. Burn to reduce the Pressure Level by one.

Crash.name: Thick Skin
Crash.description: A history of breaking yourself while breaking other things has toughened you up.

Crash.name: Zero Days
Crash.description: Once per scene, ignore any damage to yourself that comes as a result of your own destructive actions.

Crash.name: The Seam Bear Secrets
Crash.description: Ancient buildings remember. Receive a whisper when you destroy an ancient structure.

Crash.name: Load-Bearing Wall
Crash.description: Use a task to identify hidden elements essential to the integrity of a structure.

Crash.name: Cannonball Dreams
Crash.description: You jump headfirst into destruction. Literally. You can use your own body as a projectile, dealing LR Blunt damage. You end up wherever you land.

Crash.name: Padded Boilersuit
Crash.description: You're resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Blunt, Spike, Hewing, Blast, Volt.

Crash.name: Broken Points
Crash.description: Increase impact when you break something as a show of strength or intimidation.

Crash.name: Crude Tools
Crash.description: Your solutions may not be clever, but they work. You may use the Break skill to construct simple tools.

Crash.name: Canis Box Detonator
Crash.description: A simple detonator used to set off explosives from a (presumably) safe distance.

Crash.name: Crash Mask
Crash.description: A mask favoured by those who work in dusty environments. You can see clearly through dust and smoke, and resist the effects of spores and bad air.

Crash.name: Baby Bombs
Crash.description: Handheld explosives waiting to be thrown. Deals LR Blast damage to multiple nearby targets at once.

Crash.name: Demolisher
Crash.description: An over-sized weapon, usually a hammer or pickaxe. Deals CQ Blunt or Spike damage. Increase impact when destroying architecture.

Crash.name: Wrecker's Globe
Crash.description: A large, heavy ball on the end of a chain. Deals CQ Blunt damage. Useful for knocking foes back.

Crash.name: Torteaver
Crash.description: A small creature with a hard shell known for gnawing through wood and stone.

Crash.name: Burrowhip Colony
Crash.description: A small colony of burrowing insects. Mark to weaken a structure without destroying it.

Crash.name: Blitceros
Crash.description: A quadruped large enough to be ridden. Tends to bring down barriers by charging into them horn-first.

Crash.name: The Joy of Direct Paths
Crash.description: Whenever your ship rams or cuts through a particularly difficult obstacle using a ratings roll, you gain a piece of salvage or specimen with the Broken tag related to the obstacle.

Crash.name: Torpedo Mallet
Crash.description: Yes, this was once an armament for a submersible. No, there really aren't many safety precautions in place. Deals CQ Blunt or Blast damage, or burn to deal Massive CQ Blast damage to multiple nearby targets (including yourself).
